OverviewSpotter empowers top YouTube creators to accelerate their business and unleash their full creative potential by giving them access to the capital, knowledge, and community they need to succeed at scale. As the top provider of creator-friendly growth capital, Spotter tailors our investments to meet the unique needs of each creator we partner with, giving them the freedom to create without compromise.Creators are free to reinvest their funds however they choose, from hiring a team, to building their own production studios, and everything in between, all while maintaining total control over their catalogs, their channels, and their future earnings. In addition to funding, Spotter provides creators with in-depth data insights into the performance of their existing content, enabling them to leverage the full value of their library, as well as the value of future uploads and how they can improve performance in the future.Featured in Forbes, Fast Company, Variety, Axios, and more, Spotter has already deployed over $600 million to YouTube creators to reinvest in themselves and accelerate their growth. Spotter has licensed content that consists of over 250,000 videos, which generate 75 billion monthly watch-time minutes. With our curated premium video catalog, we deliver a unique scaled media solution to Advertisers and Ad Agencies that is transparent, efficient, and 100% brand safe.Position is based in Los Angeles*What You’ll DoThe VP, Analytics Engineering role plays a critical role in both strategic and tactical operations that support all analytics and data science activities at Spotter. This role will be tightly integrated with the highest levels of the leadership team in daily operational execution and long-term strategic knowledge development.ResponsibilitiesPlay role of trustee of critical knowledge that transforms raw data into informationDesign, build, and deploy analytics ready datasets by processing petabytes of data on a regular basisDeliver near-real-time and non-near-real-time data and applications to a team of analysts and data scientists who create insights and analytics applications for our stakeholdersParticipate in data strategy and road map exercises, business intelligence/data warehouse product selection, design, and implementationLead in exploring new data sources that are important in maintaining and advancing the company’s competitive advantageInteract with engineering on our in-house highly available data collection and real time data processing pipeline for the analytics team's needsLead ETL Design and Development, contribute to the development of a big data platform using modern pipeline technologies such as Spark, Kafka, AirflowCurate the “business-ready” data catalog for analysts and researchers Own the visualization tools and development of all reports and dashboardsSupport and train business users on how to use data to present information correctly in visualization toolsOwn the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc to drive key business decisionsWho You AreBS/MS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or other quantitative disciplineExpert in normalization/denormalization techniques for data analysis and optimum performance in a big data environment Must have hands-on experience in modern data pipeline applicationsStrong work experience in in data warehouse, data lake design, data modeling and data managementExperience developing and managing data warehouses on a terabyte or petabyte scaleStrong experience in massively parallel processing & columnar databasesExpert in either: Redshift / Big Query / Snowflake or similar stack7+ years of work experience with ETL, data modeling, and business intelligence big data architecturesExpert in at least SQL or Python, preferably bothAdvanced skills in data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau or similar toolsNice To Have ExperienceKnowledge of YouTube or Content Creator industryStreaming data systems such as Kafka and Spark StreamingDistributed processing using tools such as Spark, Hevo etcScheduling and orchestration tools such as AirflowWhy SpotterMedical & vision insurance covered up to 100%Dental insurance401(k) matchingStock optionsAutonomy and upward mobilityDiverse, equitable, and inclusive culture, where your voice matters.In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles that will be performed in Los Angeles. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. A reasonable estimate of the current pay range is: $175-$215K salary per year. The range listed is just one component of Spotter’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include annual discretionary bonus and equity.COVID-19 Vaccination PolicySpotter requires proof of being fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as a condition of commencing employment.Spotter is an equal opportunity employer. Spotter does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic characteristics or information, marital status, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, military status, veteran status, use of or request for family or medical leave, political affiliation, or any other status protected under applicable federal, state or local laws. Equal access to programs, services and employment is available to all persons. Those applicants requiring reasonable accommodations as part of the application and/or interview process should notify a representative of the Human Resources Department.
